document.docAuthor: Li, Xin-Jiang, Shi, Jian-Ping & Dang, Yan
document.docTitle: Eotmethis shizuishanensis Li, Shi & Dang, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A review of the genus Eotmethis (Orthoptera, Acridoidea, Pamphagidae) with two new species and key to known species of the genus from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the genus Eotmethis (Orthoptera, Acridoidea, Pamphagidae) with two new species and key to known species of the genus from China

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype :
1♂ , paratypes 1♂ , 1♀ , Shizuishan, Ningxia , 2003-VII-18 , collected by Wang Wen-Qiang and Li Xin- Jiang.

Male Body medium-sized, thickset. Vertex short and wide, the width between eyes about 2.2 times the diameter of eye; lateral aspects of vertex edged by distinct carina, reaching the middle of eyes. Fastigial furrow present. Vertex depressed, with granular tubercles. Frontal ridge apparent, between the bases of the antennae projecting forward, contracted slightly under the median ocellus, widened gently downwards, widen distinctly near the base of labrum. Lateral facial carinae invisible. Eyes elliptic, vertical diameter 1.2 times horizontal diameter and shorter than the length of subocular groove distinctly. Antennae shorter, 20 segments, extending over the middle of pronotum, length of the middle segment 2.0 times as width. Pronotum rough, with short subuliform projection, anterior and posterior margin angled protruding; median carina elevated into lamellate, strongly incised by the hind transverse sulcus; metazona equal to the prozona in length, the median carina of prozona cut by two transverse sulci, in metazona the carina arc-like raised. Prosternum with a strong lamellate process on the anterior margin, divided into two acute-angle-lobes. Interspace of mesosternum lateral lobes trapezoid, wider, the width of narrowest part larger than width of broadest part of lateral lobes distinctly. Tegmina longer, reaching to the hind margin of 4th abdominal tergite, R vein without branch, M vein with one branch, Cu vein without branch. Hind femur wide and compressed, length 3.5 times of maximum width; median carina of hind femur on the upper side serrated. Hind tibia with 9 spines on the inner side and 10 spines on the outer side (including apical spine). Arolium between the claws of tarsus larger, its apex reaching the middle of claws. Tympanum organ developed, tympanal aperture expanded, tympanic flap larger. Krauss’s organ near trapezoid, with thinly rugose on surface. Abdomen dorsally with a row of tubercles in the middle. Epiproct near peltate, with longitudinal groove in middle, its both sides with carinae. Cercus long conical, not reaching the end of epiproct. Subgenital plate short, apex angle-like.

Female Body larger and thick. Vertex extremely wider, the width between the eyes about 2 times eye. Tegmina lobi-form, separated widely dorsum, the apex extending over the posterior margin of the second abdominal tergite, distinctly longer than the length of metazona. Cercus short conical. Subgenital plate projecting into an acute angle in the middle of posterior margin. Ovipositor valve very short, curve, apex acute.

Coloration. Body brown. Pronotum with two broad pale bands near the anterior margin. Dark stripe of hind wing near outer margin. Hind femur blue on inner side, upper side with two dark bands, lower knee lobe yellow on inner side. Inner side of hind tibia in the base yellowish brown and the apical part red, the remaining part dark blue. Hind tarsus yellowish brown.
Measurement (in mm). Length of body: ♂ 25.6–26.3; ♀ 33.1. Length of tegmina: ♂ 8.7–10.7; ♀ 9.9. Length of hind femur: ♂ 13.0–13.5; ♀ 16.8.

FIGURES 7–13.
Eotmethis shizuishanensis
sp. nov. 7.
body lateral view ♂; 8. epiphallus; 9. tegmen ♂; 10. head frontal view ♂; 11. head and pronotum dorsal view ♂; 12. end of abdomen lateral view ♂; 13. body, lateral view ♀.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The new species is similar to
Eotmethis xiai Ye, Shi & Zhi, 2015
. The major differences are listed in Table 1 .
Etymology. The specific epithet is named for Shizuishan, the type locality.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 1. Comparison of the major morphological characters between
Eotmethis shizuishanensis
sp. nov.
and
E. xiai Ye, Shi & Zhi, 2015
.

tr.td: R vein without branch, M vein with one branch, Cu vein without branch
R vein with two branches, M vein without branch, Cu vein with one branch
Lower knee-lobe yellow on inner side
Lower knee-lobe red on inner side
